Package uk.ac.aber.cs221.gp12.game

Class Player

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.aber.cs221.gp12.game.Player
public class Player extends Object
This is the class which holds all the necessary methods and information for a player to be able to play the game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player​(int index)
    This method is a player's constructor.

      This gets the index of a player.

    • setPlayerState

      public void setPlayerState​(PlayerState newPlayerState)
      This sets the new state of a player when an action happens in the game.
      Parameters:
      newPlayerState - - The state of the player after the action has happened.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition​(int x, int y)
      This sets the position of a player at any point in the game.
      Parameters:
      x - - the position in the x-axis.
      y - - the position in the y-axis.

      public void setOrientation​(ShipOrientation shipOrientation)

    • getOrientation

      public ShipOrientation getOrientation()
      This method gets the orientation/direction the ship is facing during the game.
      Returns:
      the orientation the player's ship is facing.

      public void setName​(String name)
      This sets the name of the player.
      Parameters:
      name - - name of the player.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      This get the name of the player.
      Returns:
      name - the name the player has been set-up with.

    • getCrews

      public List<CrewCard> getCrews()
      This gets the list of crew cards a player has in its possession at any point in the game.
      Returns:
      crews - The list of crew cards the player has.

    • getTreasures

      public ArrayList<Treasure> getTreasures()
      This gets the arraylist of treasures a player has in its possession at any point in the game.
      Returns:
      treasures - The arraylist of treasures a player has.

      public int getX()

      public void setHarbour​(Harbour harbour)
      This sets the harbour a player's ship is in.
      Parameters:
      harbour - - The harbour the player is in.

    • updateMoveSpeed

      public void updateMoveSpeed​(CrewCard crewCard, boolean added)
      This adjusts the speed of the movement of a player's ship based on its fighting power, i.e. the amount of crew cards they have in their ship.
      Parameters:
      crewCard - - the crew card added which increases speed.
      added - - the added power

    • getMoveSpeed

      public int getMoveSpeed()
      This method gets the speed the player will move in. This is based on the crew cards the player has on its ship at the moment of moving.
      Returns:
      the movement speed of the player.

    • getFightingStrength

      public int getFightingStrength()
      This gets the fighting strength of a crew which determines the winner in an attack. It is based on the amount and value of crew card a player has in its ship.
      Returns:
      fightingStrength - The fighting strength of each player.

    • availableMovePositions

      public List<Integer> availableMovePositions()
      This method determines a list of available moves a player has.
      Returns:
      the list of available moves for the player.

    • setupMove

      public void setupMove()
      This sets up the next move of the player.

    • setupLoseMove

      public void setupLoseMove()
      This sets up the move of a player after they lost during an attack.

    • move

      public void move​(int index)
      This is for a player's move based on the available positions index.
      Parameters:
      index - - the index needed to see the available moves.

    • move

      public void move​(int x, int y)
      This sets up the logic needed to make players be able to carry out moves during the game.
      Parameters:
      x - - moves in the x-axis.
      y - - moves in the x-axis.

    • moveInDirection

      public void moveInDirection​(int numberOfMoves, ShipOrientation orientation)
      This method is responsible for making the player move into a certain direction and for a numbered amount of squares.
      Parameters:
      numberOfMoves - - the number of squares the player will move in.
      orientation - - the direction the player will move in.

    • teleport

      public void teleport​(int x, int y)
      This method allows players to be teleported based on outcomes of some chance cards.
      Parameters:
      x - - the x-axis position the player has been teleported to.
      y - - the y-axis position the player has been teleported to.

    • setupOrientation

      public void setupOrientation()
      This allows the UI to ask in which position the player wants to be oriented. The action is shown in the UI.

    • getHighestValueTreasure

      public Treasure getHighestValueTreasure()
      This allows the player to take the highest valued treasure from the player they defeated in an attack.

    • getHighestValueCrew

      public CrewCard getHighestValueCrew()
      This allows the player to take the highest valued crew card from the player they defeated in an attack.

    • randomCrew

      public CrewCard randomCrew()
      This method is responsible for shuffling the crew cards and make sure they're in a random order at the moment the player has them.
      Returns:
      a deck of randomly ordered crew cards.

    • attack

      public void attack​(Player defendingPlayer, boolean passingAttack)
      This is the method which shows what happens during an attack move. It contains the logic which decides which player wins and which one loses, based on fighting strength.
      Parameters:
      defendingPlayer - - the player that lost the attack.

    • canHoldTreasure

      public boolean canHoldTreasure()
      This method decides whether a player's ship can or can't hold another piece of treasure. The limit is 2 pieces per ship.
      Returns:
      the amount of treasures a ship has.

    • addTreasure

      public boolean addTreasure​(Treasure treasure)
      This method adds a treasure to a player's ship if they found they have enough space for it.
      Parameters:
      treasure - - the treasure they want to add.
      Returns:
      whether the treasure has been added or not.

    • addCrew

      public void addCrew​(CrewCard crewCard)
      This adds the crew cards to a player's ship at any point in the game.
      Parameters:
      crewCard - - The crew card added to the player's ship.

    • removeCrew

      public CrewCard removeCrew​(CrewCard crewCard)
      This is the method used to remove crew cards from a player's ship and updates its speed and fighting strength based on the crew cards left.
      Parameters:
      crewCard - - the crew which is being removed.
      Returns:
      the amount of crew cards left in the ship.

    • getCrewCard

      public CrewCard getCrewCard()
      This gets the crew card's information the player is about to pick up.
      Returns:
      the crew card's info the player is going to pick up.

    • removeTreasure

      public Treasure removeTreasure​(TreasureDetail treasureDetail)
      This method is to remove treasure from either islands or players.
      Parameters:
      treasureDetail - - the value and name of the treasure being removed.
      Returns:
      the treasure left on the place it's been removes from.

    • setupPlayerTurn

      public void setupPlayerTurn()
      This method sets up a player's turn at the beginning of the game or each time a player's turn goes from one player to another.

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      This method ends the turn of a player and moves it along tot the turn of the next player.

    • getChanceCards

      public ChanceCard getChanceCards()
      This method gets the list of chance card present on islands or players hands.
      Returns:
      the list/single chance card present after the method is called.

    • showCrewCards

      public String showCrewCards()
      This method shows the crew cards present in a ship or island at any point during the game the method's called.

    • showChanceCards

      public String showChanceCards()
      This method shows the chance cards present in a ship or island at any point during the game the method's called.

    • distanceToAPlayer

      public double distanceToAPlayer​(Player targetPlayer)
      This returns the numbered distance a player is from another player being targeted.
      Parameters:
      targetPlayer - - the player you want to know the distance to.
      Returns:
      the distance to the target player.

    • getLowestValueTreasure

      public Treasure getLowestValueTreasure()
      This method gets the lowest value of Treasure found in a ship or Island for the player to acquire it. Some chance cards and actions need this function to work.
      Returns:
      the lowest valued treasure found

    • getLowestValueCrew

      public CrewCard getLowestValueCrew()
      This method gets the lowest value of crew cards found in a ship or Island for the player to acquire it. Some chance cards and actions need this function to work.
      Returns:
      the lowest valued crew card found

    • hasTreasureOnBoard

      public boolean hasTreasureOnBoard()
      This method checks whether a player does or doesn't have treasure on board of their ship.
      Returns:
      true if treasure found, false if they don't

    • hasCrewOnBoard

      public boolean hasCrewOnBoard()
      This method checks whether a player does or doesn't have crew cards on board of their ship.
      Returns:
      true if crew cards found, false if they don't

    • pickCrewCard

      public CrewCard pickCrewCard()
      This allows a player to select the crew card they want to acquire from another player's deck. Used in attacks and for some chance card actions.
      Returns:
      the crew card the player has selected.

    • searchForCrew

      public CrewCard searchForCrew​(String CrewColour, int CrewStrength)
      This method looks for the crew card's features in a specific deck.
      Parameters:
      CrewColour - - the colour of the crew card.
      CrewStrength - - the fight strength of the crew card.
      Returns:
      the features of the crew cards in the deck being checked.

      public boolean hasChanceCard()

    • removeCrewCardFromPlayerToPirateIsland

      public void removeCrewCardFromPlayerToPirateIsland​(Player player, CrewCard crewCard)

    • returnRandCrew

      public CrewCard returnRandCrew​(Player player)
